thread.title: All lanes open after sinkhole opens and watermain break in Brampton
thread.title_full: All lanes open after sinkhole opens and watermain break in Brampton

author: Ryan Rumbolt
title: All lanes open after sinkhole opens and watermain break in Brampton
text:
All eastbound lanes on a busy Brampton street have been reopened following a watermain break and a sinkhole that caused congestion for days.
The “dangerous” sinkhole opened around 1:20 p.m. on Monday on Steeles Avenue between Airport Road and Goreway Drive in Brampton, Peel Regional Police said.
A watermain break had been reported hours earlier in the area by Peel Public Works.
Police closed all eastbound lanes of Steeles Avenue in the area on Monday, and all but one lane was reopened by Wednesday.
Peel Public Works said on Thursday that the watermain break has been fixed and all traffic lanes are open.
